snippet: With a few semi-autobiographical exceptions, the stories in Alice Munro’s latest volume have a terseness and a sense of impatience that her earlier ones did not.
abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book Dear Life: Stories by Alice Munro.
lead_paragraph: With a few semi-autobiographical exceptions, the stories in Alice Munro’s latest volume have a terseness and a sense of impatience that her earlier ones did not.

headline.print_headline: Recalling Lives Altered, In Ways Vivid And Untidy
headline.main: Recalling Lives Altered, in Ways Vivid and Untidy
